did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, schedules, public opinion polling data, promotional material, press releases, news summaries, and clippings, relating to the political career of Ronald Reagan, the 1976 and 1980 Reagan presidential campaigns, and speaking and writing projects of Ronald and Nancy Reagan.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Deaver & Hannaford records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1976

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biography Note
bioghist.p: American public relations firm, based in Los Angeles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, schedules, public opinion polling data, promotional material, press releases, news summaries, and clippings, relating to the political career of Ronald Reagan, the 1976 and 1980 Reagan presidential campaigns, and speaking and writing projects of Ronald and Nancy Reagan

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in Stanford University's online catalog.

did.unittitle: Adler et al; contracts and correspondence,

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, memoranda, and publishing agreement
Includes correspondence with Hugh Hefner and Art Linkletter and also some from later years.

did.unittitle: LP record album "Ronald Reagan: The Great Moments," drafts, proofs, transcripts, memos, and correspondence,
Memoranda, including related materials, to Governor Ronald Reagan from

scopecontent.p: Includes memoranda and contract for LP records of Ronald Reagan's radio broadcasts

did.unittitle: "The Reagan Record, 1967-1974," 1979 November, a compilation of Ronald Reagan's accomplishments based on contemporaneous and retroactive newspaper and magazine articles, political biographies, press releases, and speeches of Governor Ronald Reagan and other administration officials

scopecontent.p: Includes list of correspondents and The Evolution of Soviet Security Strategy, 1965-1975, Avigdor Haselkorn, 1978

did.unittitle: "Shining City on a Hill," speech, American Society of Newspaper Editors,
"Leadership and Presidency," speech, CBS Radio Network,
Acceptance speech, GOP Convention, Detroit, Michigan,

scopecontent.p: Typescript and printed copy. Includes correspondence and memoranda.

Undated, letter from Ronald Reagan in support of A Hard Look at the New Cuba, a television/film program

Information about family, films, first term as governor, private life at the ranches, 1976 campaign; memorandum from Peter Hannaford to Nancy Reagan re book questionnaire; and memorandum re Good Housekeeping photographs ,
Memorandum from Peter Hannaford to Ronald Reagan re radio taping,
Memoranda to Governor Ronald Reagan and Nancy Reagan.

scopecontent.p: Includes handwritten comments by Ronald Reagan

scopecontent.p: Includes memoranda, reprints of a television interview and radio program, and some of Ronald Reagan's speeches and statements

did.unittitle: Reprints of different radio programs, editorials, and newspaper columns Select Committee,
"Controlling Crime in California," report of the Governor's,
Statements by Ronald Reagan on various subjects, such as abortion, agriculture, civil rights, Cuba, Cyprus, insurance, labor, law enforcement, USSR, and Vietnam,
Office file of Governor Ronald Reagan,

"Californians for Lower Taxes," memorandum to all county chairmen, 1973 September 20; "Consumer Price Index," 1974 February; and "Governor's Survey on Efficiency and Cost Control–-Summary Report and Recommendations,"
"Ronald Reagan Speaks Out on the Issues,"
State of the State Address, 1974 January 9, and Reagan and Bush campaign materials,
Carter vs. Reagan's stand on various issues,

"A Study of the Administration of State Health Programs," State of California,
Economy in government and philosophy of government (clippings),
Remarks, Edmund G., Sr., on election of 1966,

scopecontent.p: Includes a report, "An Urban Strategy for California," 1978

did.unittitle: Interview, Meet the Press, James J. Kilpatrick, Washington Star Syndicate; Tom Braden, Los Angeles Times Syndicate; Robert Novak, Chicago Sun-Times; and Catherine Mackin, NBC News as panelists,
Commencement Address, California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo,
"Summary of Actions and Programs of Governor Ronald Reagan's Administration, 1967-1974."
"Summary of Actions and Programs of Governor Ronald Reagan's Administration, 1967-1974,"

"California Health Security Program, " undated; "Six Basic Plan Concepts Used for California School Housing," undated; "Stock Plans for Schools," 1969; "The People's Park: A Report on a Confrontation at Berkeley, California," 1969 July 1; "Time Is Running Out, The Environmental Crisis: A Call to Action," summary proceedings, Governor's Conference on California's Changing Environment, Los Angeles, California, 1969 November 17-18; Pacific Business, 1970 January-February; Careers in California State Government,

California Health Security Program, undated; Inaugural Message of Ronald Reagan, 1967 January 5; Budget Message of Ronald Reagan, 1967-1971; Text of State of the State message, 1968-1970; State of California Budget Summary, 1970-1971; and Inaugural address of Governor Ronald Reagan,
Reports: "Emission Inventories," 1969 November; "Air Pollution Control in California," 1970 January; and State of California: Environmental Quality Study Council,",

Report of the Governor's Commission on the Law of Preemption, undated; "Violence in the City: An End or a Beginning?" Report by the Governor's Commission on Los Angeles Riots, 1965 December 2; Tax Message of Ronald Reagan, Governor of California, 1967 March 8; Tax Reform Program for California, 1969 April; "Budget Message," 1969-1973; Report to Governor Ronald Reagan on Violence in California Prisons,

Economic report of the Governor, 1967-1973; reorganization of the executive branch of the California state government, 1969-1971; health reorganization message, 1970; "Is the Present Anxiety About Public Education Justified?" remarks, Alex C. Sherriffs, Rational Debate Seminar, American Enterprise Institute, Washington, D.C., 1970 May 6; and "Public Challenge and Campus Response," Alex C. Sheriffs, Western Interstate Commission for Higher Education, University of California, Berkeley,
"Reorganization Message of Ronald Reagan: Governor of California," 1969 March 5 and "Progress Report on Development of State Environmental Goals and Policy,"

State of the State Message, 1971 January 12, typescript; Commonwealth Club of California, 1971 June 22, typescript; Republican State Central Committee Meeting, Los Angeles, California, 1971 October 2, typescript; and Long Beach Joint Service Clubs, Long Beach, California, 1972 April 7, typescript
Writings by others about Governor Ronald Reagan's records and policies,

"The Equal Education Plan for Higher Education in California," 1967 July 25; "California Quenches Her Big Thirst," James H. Winchester, Reader's Digest, 1970; and "Governor Ronald Reagan: Action and Result,",
Budget message of Governor Ronald Reagan,

scopecontent.p: Includes some of Governor Reagan's speeches. Printed copy

scopecontent.p:
This addition to the collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover
Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described. Contact
us at hooverarchivesinfo@stanford.edu
